signal_description: Retrieve the average cycle time and number of PO items created per month. The cycle time is calculated by subtracting the last end time of Create PR Item from the last end time of Create PO Item. The PR creation date is truncated to the first day of the month.
llm_output:
{
"signal_description": "Retrieve the average cycle time and number of PO items created per month. The cycle time is calculated by subtracting the last end time of Create PR Item from the last end time of Create PO Item. The PR creation date is truncated to the first day of the month."
}

The signal_description was constructed by breaking down the SIGNAL query into its component parts and describing each part in a human-readable format.

* "SELECT": The query starts by selecting columns from a table.
* "DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT LAST (END_TIME) FILTER (WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PR Item')))) AS "PR Creation Date"": This part of the query selects the last end time of all events with the name "Create PR Item" and truncates it to the first day of the month. This column will contain the PR creation date for each month.
* "AVG ((SELECT LAST (END_TIME) FILTER (WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PO Item'))) - (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME) FILTER (WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PR Item')))) AS "AVG Cycle Time"": This part of the query calculates the average cycle time by subtracting the first end time of all events with the name "Create PR Item" from the last end time of all events with the name "Create PO Item".
* "COUNT(case_id) as "No of. PO Items"": This part of the query counts the number of case IDs that have an event name of "Create PO Item".
* "FROM "defaultview-431"": This part of the query specifies the table to use for the query.
* "WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES ('Create PR Item' ~> 'Create PO Item')": This part of the query filters the events to only those that have a name that starts with "Create PR Item" and ends with "Create PO Item".
* "ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST": This part of the query sorts the results by the first column in ascending order, with null values appearing first.
* "FILL timeseries('MONTH')": This part of the query fills in missing values in the time series data for each month.

Overall, the SIGNAL query is designed to retrieve the average cycle time and number of PO items created per month, starting from the date of the last PR item creation.
llm_input:
[INST]
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT LAST (END_TIME) FILTER (
    	WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PR Item')))) AS "PR Creation Date",
        
    AVG ((SELECT LAST (END_TIME) FILTER (
    	WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PO Item'))) 
    - (SELECT FIRST (END_TIME) FILTER (
    	WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PR Item')))) AS "AVG Cycle Time",
	COUNT(case_id) as "No of. PO Items"

FROM "defaultview-431" 
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES ('Create PR Item' ~> 'Create PO Item')
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('MONTH') 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
[/INST]
